page.title: 07SHEERNESS AND BRIELLE
page.content: TWINNING STARTED IN 1967 WHEN LOCAL AUTHORITIES BORDERING THE MEDWAY DECIDED TO CELEBRATE THE DEFEAT OF THE DUTCH IN I667 AFTER THEIR INVASION OF QUEENBOROUGH. QUEENBOROUGH THEN DECIDED TO TWIN WITH A DUTCH TOWN.BRIELLE WAS CHOSEN BECAUSE OF ITS SIMILAR MARITIME HISTORY AND THE FACT THAT, GEOGRAPHICALLY,THEY OCCUPY SIMILAR POSITIONS ON ISLANDS IN ESTUARIES OF IMPORTANT RIVER SYSTEMS. IT WAS AGREED THAT TWINNING SHOULD ENCOMPASS THE WHOLE OF THE ISLE OF SHEPPEY. SINCE THEN MANY LOCAL SPORTS CLUBS HAVE ORGANISED EXCHANGES AND COMPETITIONS WITH BRIELLE.ALSO THE {QUEENBOROUGH-BRIELLE}COMMITTEE REGUARLY VISIT THE COUNTRY.
